Title: Design of electronic information board communication system wired and wireless based
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sunarsa, K.D.N., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The utilization of technology as delivery of information media is widely used today and electronic information board is one of it. The purpose of this project is to make use of a wired and wireless network to make a communication system for an electronic information board. RaspberryPi module is used for storing and displaying the data which connected to monitor using HDMI connector. The device that used to send data (laptop) connected to RaspberryPi by UTP Cable (Wired) and/or Wi-Fi (Wireless). Wired network communication has an error presentation 0% while in wireless network is 0,083%. Data transfer in wired and wireless communication generate an exponential curve where the value will increase bigger in a certain size. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Electronic information board; RaspberryPi; Wired communication; Wireless communication

Title: Human tracking system in a certain area based on IoT application
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: This research is a development of previous research that was successfully published in early 2017. The research was continued by combining RFID, GPS, IP Camera and a smartpone android in order to build human tracking and monitoring system. All the item are connected to each other by Wi-Fi and will convey data to a station pc in the control room. Theme park as the location for deploying the system is the large area, consist of many indoors and outdoors playground and can be visited up to 4000 people/day. Human tracking and monitoring system is important for people who visit theme park, it help visitors to locate the position of their families, friends and relatives who are separated. The tracking system that is built using RFID and GPS works properly with 100% accuracy of indoor tracking and 3.27 meters erorrs for the outdoor tracking while the monitoring system that is built using IP camera and android smartphone also works properly with 100% accuracy in plotting the location of the object tracked to the map and 100% correctly choose active IP Cameras that is nearest to the object tracked. Thus this human tracking and monitoring system is suitable to track and monitor the human position for both indoor and outdoor especially in a theme park. © 2020, IJSTR.
Author Keywords: Android Smartphone; GPS; Human Tracking; IoT Application; IP Camera; Monitoring System; RFID
Funding Text 1: The authors wish to thank Bina Nusantara University. This work was supported by a grant from Bina Nusantara University

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Budijono S., Saleh R.
Title: Development of home security system using ESP8266 and android smartphone as the monitoring tool
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: With the increasing number of homes being developed in Jakarta and surrounding area, a home security system is needed to prevent disruption to every home and residents especially when the number of crime increasing. With this system, residents are guaranteed security all the time either when residents are at home or outside the home. This paper demonstrates the implementation of home security system for homes using low cost and low power consumption wireless security systems. In this eco-friendly home security system, devices are installed in every home and will promptly notify residents and local security personnel during interruptions. The owner receives a Short Message Service (SMS) with a link to open the application installed in his/her android smartphone. The security guard also receives SMS with a link to open the map application to show the location of the house using its android smartphone. A 100% success rate of sending SMS and a 100% sensors functionality was proven through the experiment. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: android smartphone; GSM module; Home security system; sensors
Index Keywords: Security systems; Sensors; Smartphones; Text messaging; Android smartphone; Gsm modules; Home security systems; Low-power consumption; Monitoring tools; Security personnel; Short message services; Wireless security systems; Android (operating system)

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Patria D., Budijono S., Saleh R.
Title: Human tracking application in a certain closed area using RFID sensors and IP camera
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 3rd International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering, ICITACEE 2016
Affiliations: Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Patria, D., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Human tracking applications with a Global Positioning System (GPS) can get the user's position in real time on the open area. But if the user goes into the room or building, then the human tracking application cannot get the user's position as the GPS signal cannot get through the wall. By using RFID, human tracking application can perform tracking in a certain closed area by providing room's or building's information that is entered. The IP camera as part of the system will send the images as visualization inside the room. In this research, human tracking system is built on a specific area that has lots of room or building such as a theme park or sports club. System is designed using an RFID reader, RFID tags, IP Camera, the database server and Android smartphones. The research was done inside Syahdan Campus, Bina Nusantara University - Jakarta. The result shows that the application is working with 100% tapping and mapping accuracy. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Android; closed area; IP Camera; RFID; smart phone
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Cameras; Radio frequency identification (RFID); Smartphones; Android; closed area; Data-base servers; Human tracking systems; IP camera; Mapping accuracy; Specific areas; Through the wall; Global positioning system

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Hendry H., Pranoto J.A., Kurniawan A., Budijono S., Saleh R., Hedwig R.
Title: Human tracking in certain indoor and outdoor area by combining the use of RFID and GPS
Source title: APWiMob 2016 - IEEE Asia Pacific Conference on Wireless and Mobile 2016, Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendry, H., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pranoto, J.A., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, A., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A similar research experiment on the use of global positioning system (GPS) had successfully been published in 2014 [1]. In this paper, the research was continued by combining radio-frequency identification (RFID) and GPS in order to get better human tracking in both indoor and outdoor area. For indoor tracking, an RFID tag was carried by a user and continually read whenever he/she accessed a room while GPS was used mainly when the user was staying outdoor. GPS would be automatically activated whenever the user leaved the room 3 meters away. The accuracy of this tracking was 100% and the GPS could allocate the user every 3.27 meters. Thus this application is suitable to track the human position for both indoor and outdoor. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ADB; GPS; human tracking; raspberry pi; RFID
Index Keywords: Radio frequency identification (RFID); Human Tracking; Indoor tracking; RF-ID tags; Global positioning system

Authors: Suhartono D., Wibowo A., Wiguna S., Saleh R.
Title: Developing controller area network management application based on modbus in multi generator set controller through local network and internet
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Department Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan 9, Kemanggisan, West-Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, D., School of Computer Science, Department Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan 9, Kemanggisan, West-Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Wibowo, A., School of Computer Science, Department Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan 9, Kemanggisan, West-Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Wiguna, S., School of Computer Science, Department Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan 9, Kemanggisan, West-Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., School of Computer Science, Department Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan 9, Kemanggisan, West-Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research is conducted to design and make a new application which can monitor multiple genset based on Modbus protocol through local network and internet. Thus, the aim is also including information gathering about all needs to do genset monitoring activity. Application s advantage is to facilitate genset technician in monitoring multi genset wherever they are only by using an interface. Methodology used are literature reviews and field studies. Result of this research is a daemon application that actively monitor all gensets which area connected each other, a database for data monitoring, and web server which determine a real time information recall despite of its easiness since it can be accessed through web browser. Multi generator set monitoring using one single screen surely can improve the effectiveness and efficiency monitoring work. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Controller-area network; Generator set controller; Modbus
